articles.author: Clive Hammond
articles.title: EU on brink: Sweden's 'mourning' for UK after Brexit 'could quickly morph' into divorce - Daily Express
articles.description: THE EUROPEAN UNION was under threat after a political commentator warned Sweden's 'mourning' for the UK over Brexit 'could quickly morph' into the country's own divorce from Brussels.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Portugal to begin reopening to EU tourists from Monday - RTE.ie
articles.description: Portugal is to resume admitting tourists from most European countries on Monday, the interior ministry said, following months of restrictions to prevent the spread of Covid-19.
articles.content:

articles.title: Call for WhatsApp to Revise Privacy Policy in South Africa - SAPeople News
articles.description: The Information Regulator of South Africa has after correspondence, written to WhatsApp LLC requesting the company to revise its privacy policy in South Africa to the standard used in the European Union (EU). On 15 May 2021, WhatsApp will require users to acc…
articles.content:
On 15 May 2021, WhatsApp will require users to accept new terms and conditions for using the app.

articles.author: Silvia Amaro
articles.title: Greece’s glittering holiday islands reemerge from the shadow of coronavirus lockdowns - CNBC
articles.description: The Greek government has a message to lure mainly northern Europeans, who are desperate for some warmer weather and a holiday: "All you want is Greece."
articles.content:
Aerial images of Kea island also known as Gia or Tzia, Zea, and, in antiquity, Keos, is a Greek island in the Cyclades archipelago in the Aegean Sea. Kea is part of the Kea-Kythnos regional unit.
